elements.name: Jungle Intro
elements.html:
Situation

You are in a civil affairs element operating in a mountainous jungle region during the rainy season of a friendly Asian country in support of our US embassy. While not directly a threat, drug cartels operate in the area.

Mission

Your mission is to interact with local authorities to assess needs and possible US interventions in support of local development.

Execution

You are to move in four-man teams for key leader engagements and assessment of infrastructure and human terrain. You are a medic on the detail. 

Admin & Logistics

You are operating out of a two-bedroom safehouse in a local village, four hours from the nearest city and the US embassy. You have a makeshift aid station in your safehouse designed to treat your teammates. You have one day of supplies of rations, medical supplies, and ammunition with you. Resupply will take 24 hours. Each individual has their own first aid kit. You have no information yet on local medical authorities and capabilities. 

Command & Signal

  • Rules of engagement (not fire unless fired upon) 
  • Medical rules of engagement (May treat, but not evacuate civilians – life, limb, or eyesight)  
  • Treatment of enemy consistent with Geneva conventions (have to treat enemy like allies)
  • You have a satellite phone

elements.name: Probe 1-1
elements.title:
Context:
Your team is in one vehicle en route to a key leader engagement when a civilian car strikes your vehicle on the driver side at a crossroads. Both vehicles have damage, but your team is able to self-evacuate from the vehicle. Two of your team members have injuries and you do not know if there are other casualties in the other car.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 1-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Search other vehicle for more casualties

elements.name: Probe 1-2
elements.title:
Context:
There are no additional casualties at this time. You have conducted a preliminary visual assessment. You can take vitals at the risk of delaying time critical treatment.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 1-2
elements.title: What is your plan of action?
choices: Perform vitals assessment on Casualty U
Perform vitals assessment on Casualty V
Apply Pain Med/Aid Bag to Casualty U
Apply Pain Med/Aid Bag to Casualty V

elements.name: Probe 1-3
elements.title:
Context:
You were able to get more vitals on both known casualties.  You only have one day's worth of supplies. If you were to treat Casualty U first:

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 1-3
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Provide burn dressing with pain control

elements.name: Probe 2-1
elements.title:
Context:
You decide to give both casualties morphine for pain. While you are treating Casualty U, both Casualty U and Casualty V lose consciousness and stop breathing. You are the only medical provider and realize you cannot treat both casualties effectively.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 2-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Stop treatment and assess Casualty V
Do not treat and search for help
Call to find out if additional support is possible

elements.name: Probe 2-2
elements.title:
Context:
The local medical provider from a nearby village arrives, but have no airway equipment and limited training. Both Casualty U and Casualty V are unconscious and still not breathing.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 2-2
elements.title: What is your plan of action?
choices: Plan to treat both by alternating bag valve mask (BVM)

elements.name: Probe 2-3
elements.title:
Context:
You decide the local medical provider is not helpful and are monitoring both casualties. Casualty U’s breathing and consciousness improves with NPA. Casualty V is still unconscious and stops breathing. You suspect swelling in the airway based on how you hear Casualty V breathing..

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 2-3
elements.title: What action do you take for casualty V?
choices: Provide burn dressing with pain control

elements.name: Probe 2-4
elements.title:
Context:
As the effects of morphine wears off, both casualties regain consciousness, and are alert and oriented before you did an airway intervention. You decide to treat the burns. You only have one burn kit, where there aren't enough burn dressings to cover both casualties' burns. Improper dressing will increase the chance of infection and pain.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 2-4
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Carefully divide the burn kit to cover the worst burns on each casualty

elements.name: Probe 3-1
elements.title:
Context:
You need to evacuate both Casualties U and V as soon as possible. You are unable to confirm with local care facilities if they can treat the patients’ injuries and the transport will take 4 hrs.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 3-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Hold casualties until you get updated info on local hospital's capabilities to manage the casualties
Hold casualties until you get updated info on the capabilities of the embassy
Not assessing local capabilities and move forward with evacuating

elements.name: Probe 3-2
elements.title:
Context:
You learn that the local hospital has a burn unit, and they can only take one casualty. The local embassy has a small clinic with minimal care capabilities for unlimited patients. It takes four hours to get to either facility.

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 3-2
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Evacuate Casualty U to local hospital
Evacuate Casualty V to local hospital
Evacuate Casualty U to the embassy
Evacuate Casualty V to the embassy
Take both casualties to the embassy

elements.name: Probe 4-1
elements.title:
Context:
If you were to handoff this casualty to another medical professional, what do you tag them?

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 4-1
elements.title: What tag would you give casualty U?

elements.name: Probe 4-2
elements.title:
Context:
If you were to handoff this casualty to another medical professional, what do you tag them?

patients.name: Casualty U
patients.injury: Has a circumferential second and third degree burn of the right arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

patients.name: Casualty V
patients.injury: Has a second and third degree burn of the left arm encompassing 9% of body surface area.

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 4-2
elements.title: What tag would you give casualty V?

elements.name: Scene 2 intro
elements.title: Now beginning Scene 2

elements.name: Probe 5-1
elements.title:
Context:
Imagine that you are back at the scene of the car accident as it just happened, your team members are all stable and healthy. You assess the other vehicle and find two civilian casualties. Both have left the vehicle.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 5-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Apply Decompression Needle to Casualty W

elements.name: Probe 5-2
elements.title:
Context:
Other team members are searching for other casualties, and you have conducted a preliminary visual assessment of Casualties W and X. You can take vitals at the risk of delaying time critical treatment.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 5-2
elements.title: What is your plan of action?
choices: Perform vitals assessment on Casualty W
Perform vitals assessment on Casualty X
Apply Decompression Needle to Casualty W

elements.name: Probe 5-3
elements.title:
Context:
You were notified that there were no other casualties, and you were able to get more vitals on the two casualties.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 5-3
elements.title: What action do you take for Casualty W?

elements.name: Probe 6-1
elements.title:
Context:
You performed treatment to Casualty W. Both Casualty W and X lose consciousness.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 6-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Get updated vital signs on Casualty W
Assess Casualty W for internal bleeding
Assess Casualty X for pelvic fracture
Get updated vital signs for Casualty W
Assess Casualty X for internal bleeding

elements.name: Probe 6-2
elements.title:
Context:
You believe Casualty X does not have a pelvic fracture, but they are still unconscious. The updated vitals on both casualties remain relatively the same, besides GCS.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 6-2
elements.title: What action do you take for Casualty X?

elements.name: Probe 7-1
elements.title:
Context:
You need to evacuate both Casualties W and X as soon as possible. You are unable to confirm with local care facilities if they can treat the patients’ injuries and the transport will take 4 hrs.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 7-1
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Hold casualties until you get updated info on local hospital's capabilities to manage the casualties
Hold casualties to determine if they can be transported
Move forward with evacuating without confirming care capabilities

elements.name: Probe 7-2
elements.title:
Context:
Your vehicle is still functional and capable of transporting the casualties. You decide under medical rules of engagement that you will treat these casualties for life-threatening injuries. For the foreseeable future, the only possible source of evacuation for these casualties is your vehicle. The local hospital is four hours away over treacherous terrain through drug cartel occupied areas. You call the hospital on your satellite phone, and they say they can only take one casualty.

patients.name: Casualty W
patients.injury: Has an injury to the chest (right chest) with multiple (broken bone) on the right side and progressively worsening difficulty in breathing.

patients.name: Casualty X
patients.injury: Closed femur (broken bone (thigh)) of the left leg with a potential (left side)  (broken bone).

elements.name: SoarTech Jungle 7-2
elements.title: What action do you take?
choices: Transport Casualty U to local hospital
Transport Casualty V to local hospital
Transport both casualties to the local hospital despite hospital availability
Transport Casualty U to the local safehouse
Transport Casualty V to the local safehouse
Keep both casualties at the local safehouse
